There are urban colectivo's, but the city is small enough that it is best to walk.
Not too much, Ocosingo is mainly a jumping off point for

value: Market where countryside woman sell their products. Worth to see even if you don't want to buy anything. Has a flair of village life. Between 2a Av. Sur Ote and  3a Av. Sur Ote four blocks east (downhill) from the plaza.

There are Automatic Teller Machines (ATM) in Ocosingo.  Before heading into Laguna Miramar you should pull out any needed cash here.
There are a number of decent hotels off of the main plaza that are priced under $30 USD.

value: , south side of the plaza, double rooms 300 Pesos (25$US), also rented as single rooms 250 Pesos if not too crowded. Clean big rooms with private bathroom an TV. Free WiFi and drinking water.

content=M from the plaza in a side street. Single rooms 180 Pesos (15$US), double rooms. Common bathrooms. Economic restaurant in the entrance hall. Very familiar with permanently running TV. Used to be a highly frequented meeting point for budget travellers as long as under US American ownership. Around 2005, the old owner has been driven out by
